title: Cards & Modern Payments

sections.title: Vocabulary: Traditional & Digital Money
sections.content:
We use different methods to pay today:

- **Cash**: Physical notes and coins.
- **Debit Card**: Direct payment from your bank account.
- **Credit Card**: Paying with borrowed money (pay later).
- **Contactless**: Tapping your card or phone to pay instantly.
- **Mobile Payment**: Using your phone (Apple Pay, Google Pay) as a wallet.
- **PIN**: Your secret 4-digit code for security.

sections.title: Grammar: Demonstratives (This, That, These, Those)
sections.content:
Use these words to point to money and cards:

1. **Singular**:
   - **This**: Close to you. (*This card in my hand.*)
   - **That**: Far from you. (*That ATM over there.*)

2. **Plural**:
   - **These**: Close to you. (*These coins in my pocket.*)
   - **Those**: Far from you. (*Those receipts on the table.*)

objectives: Identify traditional and modern digital payment methods
Use demonstratives to point to financial objects at different distances
Understand the basic security of PINs and contactless payments
